result.execSummary:
Travin Richard Burda was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Travin Richard Burda was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Travin Richard Burda

defendant.name: Burda, Travin Richard
defendant.address: W2419 Fox Coulee Rd, Nelson, WI 54756

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Copy of Extradition Consent and Fugitive Complaint forwarded to the Governor of Wisconsin.

Defendant Travin Richard Burda in court, in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court informs defendant he's being held on a warrant from Minnesota; explains extradition process and advises defendant of his rights.  Defendant waives extradition, signs the Waiver of Extradition and files with the court.  Court finds defendant's waiver of extradition done knowingly & voluntarily and remands him to Pepin County Jail to be turned over to Wabasha County, MN.
